page.title: 20THE SILLIES RIVER
page.content: The Sillies river, in its ten miles and more of twisted course, from its source at Bunnahone to the Erne, flows through the little village of Derrygonnelly where it kept three mills a-turning for many a year. Leaving the village it slows down along ground that is too level till it grows sluggish and sometimes floods the long valley below. In recent times many thousands of pounds have been spent by the Drainage Board on draining the river with some success, by cleaning and deepening it but not "meddling" with its course.According to the legend connected with St.Faber it has been deemed unlucky to meddle with the flow of the river.
